comments.body: Should we just move this comment to `subtract` and redefine `subtract` so that it returns `this` where it was returning `null`. This seems to be the only case where we are using `subtract`.

My thinking here is that this special case is specific to how the `VersionConditional` works and not a general property of subtracting versions.  So, it doesn't belong in `Versions`.  Additionally, there are some other cases where we call subtract, although they don't appear in this patch.
This name is confusing to me, specially at the call site. E.g. `allowMembershipAlwaysFalse(false)`. Can we use a different name? Can we write a short description of why we need this?

It might seem like a double negative, but it's actually not... it's just saying whether we should allow cases where the if statement is never taken.  There are a few conditionals where this should never happen, and this is just an easy way to set up that assertion (basically).  I will add some JavaDoc.
